reviewText:
Its an older nature film, but its a great one - I love the cinematography, the shots they chose created a bit of a story for me with each species.

You've gotta just accept the music as being fine for its time and its all good from that perspective.
I enjoyed watching this one.  Didn't have as much as the anthropomorphism that I've seen in others of this series.  The music was a bit distracting, so I turned the volume down.

Survival is a compelling thing out in the wild.  It is not to mimicked in society, yet our understanding of the food chain and our environment, helps us to be better caretakers of what God gave us.  Good film.
This show has the most horrible sound/music I've ever heard, IN MY LIFE.  It's worse than some low budget film. Whoever was responsible for the music/sound editing needs to be fired.  Nough said.
For its price, Reader's Digest DVD are a great buy.  Great Hunts is about how animals obtain food.
Great documentary on wildlife. Not in HD (which is why I only gave it 4 stars) but still good content.
Could have been more exciting. Still a good family watch.
It was interesting, educational, and entertaining.  We loved it and learned much.
It is good and informative, but sometimes a bit graphic for family.
I found show very interesting. Well done
